com.mattrader.common

Class EventManagerCom

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mattrader.common.EventManagerCom

  • public class EventManagerCom
extends java.lang.Object
    This class manage a generic type of event, a class extending this one will handle events and for every type of event there exists one EventManagerCom. For each event there may exist many different callback.

    A callback must be implemented by creating a class implementing the interface EventManagerCom.DirectaConnectorListener and override the EventManagerCom.DirectaConnectorListener.onEvent(EventObject) method

    To register a callback addDirectaConnectorListener(DirectaConnectorListener) method must be called, passing as an argument the listener implementing the callback.
    To remove a callback removeDirectaConnectorListener(DirectaConnectorListener) method must be called, passing as an argument the listener implementing the callback.

    When an event has to be fired is necessary to call receivedEvent(EventObject)

    • Method Detail

      • addDirectaConnectorListener

        public void addDirectaConnectorListener(EventManagerCom.DirectaConnectorListener lis)
        Register a EventManagerCom.DirectaConnectorListener implementing a callback. When an event is received the callback will be invoked. There may be many Listeners.
        Parameters:
        lis - - the listener implementing a callback

      • removeDirectaConnectorListener

        public void removeDirectaConnectorListener(EventManagerCom.DirectaConnectorListener lis)
        Unregister a EventManagerCom.DirectaConnectorListener implementing a callback. Remove the callback from the list. When an event is received this callback will not be invoked anymore
        Parameters:
        lis - - the listener implementing a callback

      • receivedEvent

        public void receivedEvent(java.util.EventObject event)
        This method is invoked when an event is fired. It will sequentially call any listener registered in this manager.
        Parameters:
        event - - the fired event
